title-part.text: BOLTS OR FASTENING DEVICES FOR WINGS, SPECIALLY FOR DOORS OR WINDOWS

reference.text: latching means for sideboard or tailgate structures for vehicles B62D,

; fastening devices for constructional or engineering elements E04, F16B; locks, fastening devices structurally or operatively combined or having significant cooperation with locks E05B; means for operating or controlling wing fasteners in conjunction with mechanisms for moving the wing E05F

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass only the movement essential for securing the wing is considered, e.g. a sliding bolt which is rotated on its axis to prevent its withdrawal is classified as having only a sliding movement
Attention is drawn to the definition following the title of class E05

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: In this subclass, it is desirable to add the indexing code(s) of E05Y.

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
E05C3/32 covered by E05C3/30
E05C17/06 covered by E05C17/04
E05C17/10 covered by E05C17/04
E05C21/02 covered by E05C21/00
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Bolts, latches, or equivalent wing-fastening devices, characterised by special way of movement, e.g. moving rectilinearly, pivotally or rotatively

reference.text: devices released automatically by pull or pressure on the wing E05C19/02; hasps E05C19/08; hook fastenings E05C19/10

title-part.text: Fastening devices with bolts moving rectilinearly

CPC-specific-text.text: perpendicular to the surface on which the fastener is mounted
parallel to the surface on which the fastener is mounted
parallel to the wing edge
the axis of the bolt movement forming an oblique angle with the surface from which the bolt protrudes, e.g. the wing edge

title-part.text: without latching action
with operating handle or equivalent member rigid with the bolt
with operating handle or equivalent member moving otherwise than rigidly with the bolt

CPC-specific-text.text: flush

title-part.text: with latching action

CPC-specific-text.text: With means for assisting depression of the latch bolt during latching

title-part.text: with operating handle or equivalent member rigid with the latch
with operating handle or equivalent member moving otherwise than rigidly with the latch
the handle or member moving essentially towards or away from the plane of the wing or frame

CPC-specific-text.text: flush

title-part.text: the handle or member moving essentially in a plane substantially parallel to the wing or frame

with sliding handle

title-part.text: Fastening devices with bolts moving pivotally or rotatively

CPC-specific-text.text: sliding in an arcuate guide or the like
about an axis perpendicular to the surface on which the fastener is mounted
about an axis parallel to the surface on which the fastener is mounted
parallel to the wing edge

title-part.text: without latching action
with operating handle or equivalent member rigid with the bolt

CPC-specific-text.text: rotating about an axis perpendicular to the surface on which the fastener is mounted
the handle being at one side, the bolt at the other side or inside the wing
the pivot being between bolt and handle
the bolt and handle being at the same side of the pivot
in the form of a hook
in the form of a crescent-shaped cam
rotating about an axis parallel to the surface on which the fastener is mounted
parallel to the wing edge

title-part.text: with operating handle or equivalent member moving otherwise than rigidly with the bolt
the handle or member moving essentially towards or away from the plane of the wing or frame
the handle or member moving essentially in a plane substantially parallel to the wing

CPC-specific-text.text: or frame

title-part.text: with latching action

reference.text: devices in which the securing part is formed or merely carried by a spring and moves only by distortion of the spring, e.g. snaps, E05C19/06; tilt-plate latches E05C19/007

CPC-specific-text.text: flush
with latch under compression force between its pivot and the striker

reference.text: E05C3/122, E05C3/14, E05C3/16 and E05B65/0852 take precedence

Pendulum-type bolt

title-part.text: with operating handle or equivalent member rigid with the latch

title-part.text: with operating handle or equivalent member moving otherwise than rigidly with the latch

CPC-specific-text.text: the handle or member moving essentially towards or away of the plane of the wing or frame
the handle or member moving substantially parallel to the wing or frame
the latch pivoting about an axis perpendicular to the wing

title-part.text: the bolt being spring controlled
in the form of a bifurcated member

reference.text: automatic catches with a bifurcated latch E05C19/024; locks with a bifurcated bolt E05B65/0046, E05B85/243

title-part.text: engaging a stud-like keeper
with simultaneously operating double bolts

reference.text: vehicle locks with a pair of bifurcated bolts E05B85/245

title-part.text: in the form of a hook

reference.text: hook-like fastenings E05C19/10; locks for sliding wings with pivoting bolts E05B65/0811, E05B65/0835

title-part.text: with simultaneously operating double bolts

reference.text: locks for sliding wings with bolts pivoting about an axis parallel to the wings E05B65/0835, comprising simultaneously pivoting double hook-like locking members E05B65/0858

title-part.text: in the form of a rotary gear
with bolts engaging a hooked keeper
with bolts engaging a stud-like keeper
Fastening devices with bolts moving otherwise than only rectilinearly and only pivotally or rotatively

reference.text: E05C9/1883, E05C19/009, E05B63/125, E05B63/126, E05B63/127 take precedence; pivotally-mounted hooks-like fastenings with toggle action E05C19/14; bayonet-type locks E05B63/125; locks for sliding wings, with additional movement E05B65/0817

CPC-specific-text.text: Pivoting bolts or catches being able to move in an additional direction, e.g. by sliding or by pivoting about an additional axis, in order to allow closing of the wing even if the bolt or catch is in its locked position

title-part.text: both moving axially and turning about their axis to secure the wing
performing both movements simultaneously, e.g. screwing into a keeper
Fastening devices specially adapted for two wings

note.note-paragraph: If a fastening device merely secures one wing to another wing which is already closed it is not regarded as specially adapted for two wings

CPC-specific-text.text: for sluice doors
for "Dutch doors", i.e. upper and lower wings
for a double-wing sliding door or window, i.e. where both wings are slidable

title-part.text: for wings which lie one behind the other when closed
for wings which abut when closed

CPC-specific-text.text: Sliding bolts mounted on or in the edge of a normally closed wing of a double-door or -window

title-part.text: a fastening device for one wing being actuated or controlled by closing another wing

title-part.text: Portable devices specially adapted for securing wings

CPC-specific-text.text: insertable in the gap between the wing and the frame or in the gap between a lock and its striker, e.g. for cooperation with the striker

Provisional arrangements between door and frame for holding vehicle doors closed or partially open during manufacturing or maintenance
